title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
What are the troubleshooting steps for this one if it wont power on?

I took out the board, checked under scope, literally no water anywhere, no dents on the housing, so it seems laptop was properly used.

The small white LED is on when i connect the charger (i have an original apple charger usb-c), i can measure 8V on the battery connector when they are connected.

Fixed this model few times with new keyboard and new screen, but never measured the board before.

So what measurement will i report to you?

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: also, i did not find donor board on aliexpress, only working boards for like 385eur (this is a 1.2ghz, 512gb ssd, 8gb ram model)

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
Measure the power rails with the charger connected, battery disconnected. Which are present, which are missing?

I would start with PP3V3R3V0_AON. Is this present? If not, what is its resistance to ground? If resistance to ground is below 350 ohms, does removing U4700 remove the short circuit?

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
Ppdcin_e85 : 20v

 pp3v3r3v0_aon : 3.265 v

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: ppbus g3h : 8.6V

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: The basics look good. Check all rails for shorts to GND. I had a few with a short on 5V rail.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
I came back finally to this one no shorts on any rails 
 PP5V_S0 = 0V 
line is not shorted to GND 
led is glowing a bit but laptop didn't take any current/charge, and doesn't turn on 
connected to power supply on battery connectors takes 0,10A nothing heating up.
U7100 replaced 
u4700 replaced 
no luck still not working 
Any ideas ?

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
U7100 has firmware.
New chip will not work, you need one from donor board (same model).

Do you get voltage on PPBUS_G3H with new chip???

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: Yes PPBUS_G3H present on F7140 I measured 8.05V

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
8.05V is not correct value for PPBUS_G3H.
I suppose you checked it without battery connected.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: I have connected power supply to battery connector. Should I put back U7100 ? I have another donor board with have faulty CPU, well CPU  only is heating up.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
"I have connected power supply to battery connector."
I'm not sure if I correctly understood you...
Did you connect bench power supply to battery connector, why?

You've got 8.6V with original U7100.
Did you change it in base of which reason?
Didn't measure more signals on the board?

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
Because is easier to measure both board sides with power supply, would I will getting not right measurements with power supply ? 
I replace ic to try maybe it will resolved issue, this was common issue so I tried replace it.  
I didn't measure anything more so far.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
These new boards will not start untill SMC talks with the charger...
And never change components before some measurment indicates that.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: Problem is that the laptop is not taking charge no current taken,  on old or new ic, so SMC is not talks witch charger and this U7100 is responsible for a charging as I can see on schematic

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: U7100 will not charge the battery, nor generate correct PPBUS_G3H untill SMC will permit that.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
I put back U7100 from donor board PPBUS_G3H is back to normal 8.6V 
laptop still doesn't turn on.
PP5V_S0 =0V 
PP5v1_s4w = 0V
P5VOUT_EN = 0V 
PP3V3_G3H present 
I reflow SMC but no changes.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
Post 3V3_S5, PM_SLP_SUS_L, 3V3_SUS, PM_SLP_S5_L, PCH_RSMRST_L.
Check if any pulse at least.

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and see if PM_PWRBTN_L reacts.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
I check voltages that you said

3V3_S5 = 0.5v no pulses

PM_SLP_SUS_L 0 = 0v no pules 

PM_SLP_S5_L = 3v3 no pulses 

PM_RSMRST_L = 0 no pulses 

SMC_ONOFF_L = 3v26 going down to 0.3v when power button pressed

PM_PWRBTN_L = 1.22v no changes when pressing power button

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
"3V3_S5 = 0.5v
-------------
PM_SLP_S5_L = 3v3"
Are you sure?
High level for PM_SLP_S5_L means the board already achieved S5 state and goes to S4; but you are missing a basic S5 voltage!
Check resistance to ground at L7560.
You could have a problem with U7400.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
resistance on L7560 455 ohm 
double checked PM_SLP_S5_L = 0V
I checked on TP first  but looks like board view is a bit different than the actual main board and test point wasn't for this signal

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
"PM_PWRBTN_L = 1.22v"
It has strong pull up resistor (1K) to 3V3_S5.
Remove R1405 and check its level again.

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
resistor removed still no changes on PM_PWRBTN_L 
3V3_S5 is still on 0.5v level no changes

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
Still 1.22V at PM_PWRBTN_L?
Looks like PCH issue; it should have a weak pull-up resistor inside.

Do you get AVREF_SMC voltage?

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
yes PM_PWRBTN_L have no changes I checked once more 
AVREF_SMC = 3v

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: Put good flux and heat PCH untill 180-200 degrees; just to burn eventualy crap...

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message:
PCH heated up no changes, I checked those 
 PM_PWRBTN_L 
3V3_S5
no changes on those lines after heating up too

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
message: There should be PCH/CPU, or U7400 problem...

title: 820-00045 a1534 wont turn on at all, not water damaged
